content:
Hi. I'm wondering about getting involved in this module. I'm a big fan of bootstrap, both from basic HTML sites and from experimenting with Drupal8 (before finally giving up due to the complexities of Composer). I note there is a fix to https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite/issues/19 and I have added a suggested fix to https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite/issues/6 but I don't seem to be able to do a pull request. While I don't know how to necessarily fix all the issues, it would be good to get the fixes we have into a release, but I wouldn't have the first clue how to do that. I'm a novice at git, but used it a bit, and completely brand new to Backdrop but have built Drupal 7 sites for many years. Hopefully with a bit of guidance I can help to get this project moving forward.

Update API URL · Issue #19 · backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite
The Bootswatch page is basically empty, because the API URL it's trying to call is old and doesn't work anymore. The current API URL is: https://bootswatch.com/api/4.json
Logo not showing if Site name is not checked in Configure block "Header block" · Issue #6 · backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite
If only the Logo option is checked in Configure block "Header block", the logo (default backdrop in my case) is not showing. This issue disappears if I use Bartik.

Hi, yorkshirepudding. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
@yorkshirepudding - Thanks for your interest in this Bootstrap Lite module. I would be willing to co-maintain it with you and maybe together we can figure some of the things out.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite/issues/18

Needs an official maintainer · Issue #18 · backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite
There's nothing in the README about who is maintaining this theme. Originally it was @Gormartsen but I believe he's moved on to other things. He can confirm if he'd like anyone to take ...
To get started, let's express our interest here and see if @gormartsen has any concerns. He is no longer listed as the maintainer.
@StPaulTim sounds like a plan

@yorkshirepudding - To officially become a maintainer, it's helpful to share some code or a module that you have ported. I take it that you have not done that in the past, is that correct?

Do you have any Pull Requests on other projects?
I'll check with the rest of the team, but one option would be for you to submit a couple of Pull Requests before become an official co-maintainer.
In the meantime, I'll try to figure out why you having trouble. Anyone should be able to submit a PR.
Hi @StPaulTim . correct. I'm a novice here. I haven't really contributed before other than testing on Drupal; there's always a first time though.
Absolutely, we'd love to have you help and I'll do what I can to facilitate the process.
Thanks

Here is more information about becoming an official member of the contrib group.
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib

backdrop-ops/contrib
Apply to join the contributed code developer team. - backdrop-ops/contrib
Take a look at that. It's easiest if you have a module ported or written from scratch, but there are other options.

Officially, we are supposed to wait two weeks to take over maintainership of a module if the maintainer is no longer active. But, since there is no maintainer listed on this project, we may be able to speed up the process.

@yorkshirepudding Welcome! Helping out in the issue queue is always a good first step to demonstrate your intent, and the more you can do in advance, the better your chances of being accepted. I have had numerous requests to help or take over maintainership of a module by people who never so much as answered a question in the issue queue. They get denied.
@StPaulTim he did say "but I don't seem to be able to do a pull request." I don't know if that's because he's not a contributor or what, but that seems to be a thing that should be addressed as can be.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) - Isn't is usually possible to see a list of all the folks who have forked a repo. I'm not finding that option right now.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite/network/members

backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite
Bootstrap Lite - a Backdrop Bootstrap-based theme: - backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite
That's one of those GitHubisms you have to know or search on.
@BWPanda Thanks for that. But, I'm not finding any way to find that page, if you don't know it's there. Maybe, it's visible to maintainers all the time.

I knew I had seen that list before. I think that @yorkshirepudding didn't realize that it's necessary to first fork the project before you can submit a PR. I don't think it's possible without a fork, is it?
@StPaulTim if you go to the project's home page, do you see the Insights tab under the title?
image.png
NOpe. I apparently don't have same permissions you do.
Either click the number next to Fork, or go to Insights > Forks
That was a private tab, logged out

don't think it's possible without a fork, is it?

@StPaulTim I think @klonos does that all the time.
github.png
@StPaulTim Hmmm, what happens if you logout?
Why would I log out? :-)
If I logout I see even less.
github22.png
I am able to see the list of forks if I have the link. But, I have no options to find that page unless I have it memorized.
That's odd.

@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) @StPaulTim happy to fork if that's what's is needed to do a pull request. It didn't seem right as I thought forking is what you do when you take a project in a different direction (e.g. backdrop being a fork of Drupal).

Well, that is the extreme version of forking. @yorkshirepudding - But, forking also just means creating your own copy of an existing repo where you can make changes. Then you can keep the changes yourself or create a PR and submit them back to original projects.
Related: https://backdropcms.org/news/creating-pull-requests-against-core-easy-noob-way
Thanks @Attila Vasas . I'll do this
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) @StPaulTim @Attila Vasas my first pull request

Thanks @yorkshirepudding - Looking forward to your next PR.

NOTE: I cut a new release with your change along with a few other fixes. Including a fix to make Bootswatch themes work.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite/issues/25

Future Plans for Bootstrap Lite · Issue #25 · backdrop-contrib/bootstrap_lite
I've just taken over maintaining this theme, because I think it could be a very strong(er) contribution to the theme space for Backdrop CMS and it hasn't gotten any attention for a long tim...

Thanks @StPaulTim I had a look through the current list of bugs but they are a bit beyond my skillset currently (partly as I'm still new to the backdrop layout model and partly as my coding skills in PHP are still quite basic). I'll keep an eye out for potential ones I could pick up, and happy to test and work on documenting issues or improvements (my day job is currently in business analysis)
